title: Easy Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo Recipe
description: This creamy chicken and broccoli Alfredo pasta dish with fresh broccoli, tender chunks of chicken breast, Parmesan cheese, and basil is sure to please!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Main Dishes Chicken Chicken Alfredo Recipes Easy Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo 4.3 (158) 124 Reviews 58 Photos Fettuccine is used for this chicken and broccoli Alfredo recipe but you can use your favorite pasta. Submitted by Philadelphia Updated on August 24, 2023 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 58 58 58 58 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 30 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 8 ounces fettuccine, uncooked 2 cups fresh broccoli florets ¼ cup Kraft Zesty Italian Dressing 1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cut into bite-sized pieces 1 ⅔ cups milk 4 ounces Philadelphia Cream Cheese, cubed ¼ cup Kraft Grated Parmesan Cheese ½ teaspoon dried basil leaves Directions Cook pasta as directed on package, adding broccoli to the boiling water for the last 2 minutes of the pasta cooking time. Drain pasta mixture. Meanwhile, heat dressing in large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink in the center, stirring occasionally, about 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in milk, cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, and basil. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook until sauce is well blended and heated through, about 1 to 2 minutes. Add chicken mixture to pasta mixture; mix lightly. Tips Substitute frozen peas, chopped red peppers, or any of your favorite vegetables for the broccoli. I Made It Print 339 home cooks made it! Nutrition Facts (per serving) 511 Calories 21g Fat 32g Carbs 47g Protein Show Full Nutrition Label Hide Full Nutrition Label Nutrition Facts Servings Per Recipe 4 Calories 511 % Daily Value * Total Fat 21g 27% Saturated Fat 10g 48% Cholesterol 139mg 46% Sodium 514mg 22% Total Carbohydrate 32g 12% Dietary Fiber 3g 12% Total Sugars 10g Protein 47g 94% Vitamin C 51mg 57% Calcium 259mg 20% Iron 3mg 14% Potassium 774mg 16% * Percent Daily Values are based on a 2,000 calorie diet. Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo 01 of 58 Photo by  Breanna Dean 02 of 58 Photo by  Ms Chef Esh 08/13/2024 Easy to follow Family favorite This came together so easily and I can't believe how creamy it was! I used shrimp in place of the chicken and my family loved it. I will be making this recipe again! 03 of 58 Photo by  1010lisalynn 08/11/2024 Easy and tasty indeed!This is a great recipe for beginner cooks!!So glad the top line said your favorite pasta as I didn’t have any fettucine.I believe the dish could improve with the addition of fresh or garlic powder and a bit more broccoli.The biggest issue I had is with the Italian dressing overcooking and browning the bottom of the pan. I actually had to switch to another non-stick pan to finish cooking the chicken so it didn’t burn.Changes I made to this recipe:Used spaghetti instead of fettucineUsed chicken tenders vs. chicken breast – quicker cooking time, less expensive and more tenderUsed heavy cream and 1% milkAdded about ¼ cup of the pasta water and red pepper flakes 04 of 58 Photo by  lupini 08/05/2024 A keeper! Great flavors Crowd-pleaser Chicken and broccoli Alfredo recipe is divine! It is very easy to make, and to save an extra step, I used a deep skillet that is similar to a walk. I was able to put the linguine and the brocco in it. then drained it and let it sit in my calendar while I use that same skillet to cook my chicken in the sauce. The sauce looks like it’s runny while you’re cooking it, but once it mixes in with the linguine, just melds together into this wonderful sauce. it is absolutely wonderful! Love it! 05 of 58 Photo by  Sara 04/18/2024 A keeper! My grandson helped me make this and it was good. I agree the sauce is thin but I was ok with that. It was really good for a quick dinner and I actually had all the ingredients. 06 of 58 Photo by  kris 01/06/2024 I'm not a big fan of pasta....But this one was okay 07 of 58 Photo by  Dreamy_0420 09/16/2022 This recipe was quick, easy and clean. I didn’t make any changes this time because I didn’t see a need to. I will try anything once. I just doubled the recipe so it’s a lot. 08 of 58 Photo by  Tiffany Brock 02/08/2021 09 of 58 Photo by  RitaT 02/04/2021 This is a great quick and easy recipe. I used bow tie pasta and coconut milk. The coconut milk made it a little sweet so I added extra basil. Next time I will add garlic and onion for more flavor. Also more broccoli next time. I used what I had left from another meal. Love the recipe!! 10 of 58 Photo by  Tabatha Toy 07/21/2020 1 2 3 4 5 Next You’ll Also Love Chicken Alfredo 428 Ratings Chicken Milano 2,812 Ratings Chicken & Broccoli Alfredo with Fettuccine 22 Ratings Creamy Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo 1,791 Ratings Chicken and Broccoli Alfredo 595 Ratings Chicken and Asparagus Fettuccine 130 Ratings Easy Chicken Fettuccine with Sun-Dried Tomatoes 9 Ratings Homemade Chicken Fettuccine 252 Ratings Jerked Chicken Alfredo 1 Rating Chicken Piccata with Fettuccine 13 Ratings Joel's Jerk Chicken Pineapple Pasta 119 Ratings Chicken Alfredo with Fettuccini Noodles 298 Ratings Lighter Chicken Fettuccine Alfredo 140 Ratings Chicken Primavera Alfredo 36 Ratings Thai Stir-Fried Noodles (Pad See Ew) 2 Ratings Creamy Pasta Primavera with Chicken and Sausage 1 Rating Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices   Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith publishing family. name: Philadelphia
instructions: Cook pasta as directed on package, adding broccoli to the boiling water for the last 2 minutes of the pasta cooking time. Drain pasta mixture.;Meanwhile, heat dressing in large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat. Add chicken and cook until no longer pink in the center, stirring occasionally, about 5 to 7 minutes.;Stir in milk, cream cheese, Parmesan cheese, and basil. Bring to a boil, stirring constantly. Cook until sauce is well blended and heated through, about 1 to 2 minutes.;Add chicken mixture to pasta mixture; mix lightly.
